title: Introduction to Real Pen Work
subject: introductory; real pen work; self instruction
description: This is the title page and introduction to the book.

title: Wonderful Improvement
subject: practice makes perfect; write just like him
description: The book implies that with practice, you can become an expert writer like the man on the page.

title: How to Hold Your Pen
subject: write with an elegant hand; the basics
description: This page explains how holding a pen properly and being seated properly is crucial for penmanship.

title: Practice Goes a Long Way
subject: practice; movements; exercises
description: These are exercises to be practiced before writing.

title: Exactly Fifty Two Degrees
subject: precision; a highlighted importance
description: Letters must be at a fifty two degree angle in order to be perfectly written.

title: Example of Captail Letter Practice
subject: analyzed and explained; practice of stroke and width
description: Here is an example of capital letters from the alphabet and how they are represented within the book.

title: The Tracing Process
subject: ornament penwork; a learning curve
description: This page explains to the reader how to trace, and that it is so easy, a child could do it.

title: Stylized Letters for Interest
subject: an example; traced letters; stylistic
description: These are letters that have been traced effectively for reference for the reader.

title: Tracing and Drawing of a Bird
subject: imagrey; illustration; bird in pen
description: An example of a bird that has been drawn utilizing the tracing process.

title: Tracing and Drawing of a Horse
subject: imagery; illustration; horse in pen
description: An example of a horse that has been drawn utilizing the tracing process.

title: Distant from Black and White
subject: coloured image; flexibility of penwork
description: At the end of the book, there are some coloured images. This is the most intricate and it, once again, utilized the tracing process.

title: An Example of Fonts
subject: fonts; languages; stylistic
description: An example of fonts in regard to Old English and Germanic writing.

title: Writing in a Letter Example One
subject: penwork from 1812; progression of style
description: From 1812, this is an example of caligraphy and writing. We can see the letters are slanted and have thickness to them in certain curves and edges.

title: Writing in a Letter Example Two
subject: penwork from 1835; progression of style
description: From 1835, we can see that caligraphy and writing has stayed consistent with the standards of penmanship. Thus, this book has heavy emphasis on making sure the practice of writing maintains its idealism.
